hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Funnel into Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: Incoming macro liquidity (Fed) during a neutral regime will initially compress BTC realized volatility (21-day) by >15% as markets digest flows, followed by a volatility expansion breakout in the direction of the initial 4-hour trend after compression.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Liquidity inflows in neutral regimes often cause consolidation (vol compression) before directional resolve. Compression near highs suggests accumulation. News cycle questioning 'when bull run begins' aligns with this setup.
entry_conditions: BTC 21-day realized volatility has decreased by >15% over past 5 days
BTC price trading within 2.5% of 20-day high (compression near highs)
Positive cumulative volume delta (CVD) on 4-hour over last 12 hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: Volatility expansion: 4-hour ATR(14) increases by 40% from entry level
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below key support (low of compression range -1%) on rising volume
exit_conditions.time_exit: 96 hours (4 days) after entry if no expansion

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Volatility continues to compress for >4 days without expansion, or price breaks down without a preceding compression signal.
